actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Education, Arts, and Humanities

official_title: A bill to provide a national program for improving the quality of instruction in the humanities in public and private elementary and secondary schools.
short_title: Humanities Excellence and Teacher Training Act of 1985

summary.text: Humanities Excellence and Teacher Training Act of 1985 - Directs the Secretary of Education to make grants to institutions of higher education (or a consortium of such institutions) for summer training institutes for the development of elementary and secondary school humanities teachers. Limits the amount of such a grant to any institution or consortium to an amount equal to not more than $3,000 multiplied by the number of teachers, not to exceed 200, enrolled in such institute. Sets forth grant application requirements. Requires that such grants be made on the basis of excellence of the proposed program, taking into consideration certain elements. Allows funds available to institutions under this Act to be used to cover costs associated with enrollment in an institute. Directs the Secretary to assure equitable distribution of institutes among and within States, requiring at least one institute in each State. Provides that no grant to a single applicant may exceed $600,000 in any fiscal year. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1986 through 1988.

titles.title: Humanities Excellence and Teacher Training Act of 1985
A bill to provide a national program for improving the quality of instruction in the humanities in public and private elementary and secondary schools.
